comments: Herro (MIA) extends both arms out and initiates contact with Siakam's (IND) body, which alters his driving shot attempt.
Butler (MIA) establishes himself in Nesmith's (IND) path and does not deliver illegal contact.
Nesmith (IND) clamps and holds Butler's (MIA) arm/shoulder, which affects his ability to pursue the rebound.
Herro (MIA) is in the paint for less than three seconds when he moves to imminently guard an opponent.
Adebayo (MIA) initiates contact with Nesmith's (IND) arm, which alters his driving shot attempt.
Butler (MIA) extends his arm toward the ball when marginal contact occurs as he brushes Haliburton's (IND) leg during the drive.
Adebayo (MIA) legally contests Haliburton's (IND) layup attempt.
McConnell (IND) makes contact with the part of Herro's (MIA) hand that is not on the ball during his release and affects his jump shot attempt.
Jovic (MIA) reaches for the ball and marginal contact occurs as he grazes Hailburton's (IND) arm during the steal attempt.
Butler (MIA) legally contests Haliburton's (IND) jump shot attempt.

Replay review of the foul called on Siakam (IND) pursuant to a coach's challenge was deemed unsuccessful. Siakam's right hand initiates contact with Herro's (MIA) back at the start of Herro's upward shooting motion, affecting the jump shot attempt.
Adebayo (MIA) makes clean contact with the ball, simultaneous to Herro (MIA) making incidental hand-on-ball contact to dislodge it from Turner (IND).
Siakam (IND) legally contests Herro's (MIA) jump shot attempt.
Jovic (MIA) and Nembhard (IND) engage and disengage with one another and marginal contact occurs during the inbound.
Martin (MIA) and Nesmith (IND) mutually engage and immediately disengage with one another as marginal contact occurs during the inbound.
Herro (MIA) commits a take foul on Nesmith (IND). The transition take foul rule does not apply to the last two minutes of either the fourth quarter or overtime.
Nembhard (IND) is the last player to touch the ball after he deflects the pass out of bounds. Possession is correctly retained by the Heat.
Nembhard (IND) commits a take foul on Herro (MIA). The transition take foul rule does not apply to the last two minutes of either the fourth quarter or overtime.
Herro (MIA) extends beyond the plane of the free throw line before his free throw shot attempt touches the basket.
Martin (MIA) is the last player to touch the ball before going out of bounds when he deflects the inbound pass away from Haliburton (IND).
